newsitem.title: USA: Red Oak Hereford buys Midland Cattle.
newsitem.headline: Red Oak Hereford buys Midland Cattle.

text.p: Red Oak Hereford Farms Inc said it has completed the acquisition of Midland Cattle Co in a stock-for-stock exchange valued at about $10 million.
Red Oak said its 1996 revenues, when combined with Midland Cattle Co.'s $65 million in annual revenues, will be in excess of $125 million.
Red Oak acquired Midland Cattle in exchange for 1,538,462 shares of Red Oak common stock, based on a $6.50 per share bid price.
Midland Cattle is cattle brokerage firm based in Red Oak, Iowa.

"The addition of Midland Cattle Company will contribute significantly to the revenue growth and potential profits of Red Oak Hereford Farms Inc," said Red Oak president, Gordon Reisinger, in a statement.
"Midland will play an instrumental role in developing a fed cattle supply for the Certified Hereford Beef Program," he said.
